links.*: Long live the Halflings! Praise them with great praise!

wikitext.*:
'''''-t''''' is a [[Quenya]] suffix that has three meanings.

==-t<sup>1</sup>==
Used as a dual ending, denoting a ''pair'' of something, e.g. ''márya'''t''''' ("her [pair of] hands").<ref>{{PE|Eldarin}}, p. 75, 76</ref>

==-t<sup>2</sup>==
A pronominal ending meaning "them", seen in the word ''laituvalme'''t''''' ("we shall bless them"). Also independent word '''te''', like in ''a laita '''të''''' ("praise them").<ref>{{L|230}}, p. 308 (Tolkien translates the ''[[Long live the Halflings! Praise them with great praise!|Praises of Cormallen]]'')</ref>

==-t<sup>3</sup>==
Used as a reduced pronominal affix of the 2nd person, "you" (singular). Found in ''heca'' ("be gone, stand aside"): ''heca'''t''''' (singular) and ''hecal'' (plural).<ref>{{WJ|A}}, p. 364</ref>
